result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devan J McAlister

records.addlTxt:
10:30 AM Defendant Devan J McAlister in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defendant confirms he is currently unrepresented by counsel. Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant states that he does not wish to be represented by counsel. Court advises the Defendant of possibility of PD representation, court appointed representation, and private representation.  

Defendant would like to proceed to plea/sentencing today. 

State advises that the State would not be in compliance with victim rights in order to proceed with plea and sentencing, but could proceed with a plea only. 

Court will set over for plea/sentencing hearing. 

Court again advises the Defendant of his right to counsel. Defendant was turned down by PD at last hearing date. Petition for Appointment of counsel provided to the Defendant, along with Waiver of Attorney, Plea Questionnaire, and Elements Sheet relating to charge.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Devan J McAlister
Current: Unknown,   (Effective: 09-28-2022)
Prior: 2674 N. 40th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210

addressed to: Devan J McAlister for hearing on October 12, 2022
Return to Sender, vacant, Unable to Forward.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Menards/Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

10:28 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Devan J McAlister in court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion Order to Seal Victim Identification Key, Signed by Judge Carter on 08/25/2022
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
